item.title: Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter character trailer – Estelle Bright
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/trails-in-the-sky-1st-chapter-character-trailer-estelle-bright

A girl from Liberl Kingdom training to become a Bracer.

Falcom has released the first character trailer for Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter, introducing protagonist Estelle Bright.

Here is her official description:

A bright and determined Bracer trainee of the Guild.

A girl from Liberl Kingdom training to become a Bracer in order to protect the safety of civilians and peace of cities.

A bright, outgoing, and optimistic girl who never gives up, no matter the situation. Her sincere nature leads her to trust others easily, and her actions are often impulsive.

Trained by her father, a veteran Bracer, she possesses considerable combat skills. For the past 5 years, she has been striving to become a Senior Bracer alongside her adopted younger brother, Joshua.

Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter is due out for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC via Steam on September 19 worldwide. Read more about the game here and here.

item.title: Splatoon Raiders announced for Switch 2; Splatoon 3 version 10.0.0 update launches June 12
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/splatoon-raiders-announced-for-switch-2-splatoon-3-version-10-0-0-update-launches-june-12

  • Switch
  • Switch 2

An adventure in the mysterious Spirhalite Islands with the Deep Cut trio.

Nintendo has announced Splatoon Raiders, the first-ever Splatoon spinoff game, for Switch 2. A release date was not announced. The version 10.0.0 update for Splatoon 3 will also arrive on June 12.

Here are the details:

Splatoon Raiders

In the role of a mechanic, players will go on an adventure in the mysterious Spirhalite Islands alongside the splat-tacular Deep Cut trio.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Splatoon 3 Version 10.0.0 Update

A free update for the Splatoon 3 game is coming to Nintendo Switch and Nintendo Switch 2 on June 12. The update features the Splatlands collection, consisting of new weapons from the Barazushi and Emberz brands. Based on previous weapons, these new additions have fresh looks with different sub and special weapons. There are a total of 30 new weapon kits in this collection. A returning stage from the original Splatoon game on Wii U, called Urchin Underpass, will also be added to the stage rotation.

Plus, all weapon Freshness caps will be raised and players can earn new in-game Badges. A new stat will be added for Anarchy Battle (Series) called Series Weapon Power. It will track a player’s effectiveness per weapon based on their win/loss ratio in battles – and will then match them with players of a similar power. This makes it possible for players to try new weapons without being disadvantaged and push the limits their favorite weapons.

Further, with this new update Splatoon 3 players on Nintendo Switch 2 can enjoy more detailed visuals and a smoother appearance in locations like Splatsville and the Grand Festival Grounds. Today’s trailer also confirmed that Splatoon 3 players will be able to play together across both Nintendo Switch and Nintendo Switch 2.

Watch the Splatoon Raiders and Splatoon 3 version 10.0.0 update announcement trailer below. View the first Splatoon Raiders screenshots at the gallery.
